body:
> Two things: How is adding this file removing the warning? Wouldn't this add a definition?

The warning occurred when I exec the command `$ cd activemodel && rake`.

```
/Users/tricknotes/rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/hash/deep_merge.rb:16: warning: method redefined; discarding old deep_merge!
/Users/tricknotes/.rbenv/versions/1.9.3-p362/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/i18n-0.6.1/lib/i18n/core_ext/hash.rb:25: warning: previous definition of deep_merge! was here
```

In `i18n` gem, the method definition of  `Hash#deep_merge!` is skipped when it is already defined.

So, I use `require 'active_support/core_ext/hash/deep_merge.rb'` before `require 'i18n'`.

> Secondly, I'm not entirely sure this belongs inside the begin block: we know it will be always loaded, since it's also ActiveSupport.

Ah, that's right. It is unnecessary in begin block.
